variants.Description in input context: A missense mutation in the SNCA gene (p.E46G) associated with Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant SNCA plasmids.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing the p.E46G variant showed 40% reduced viability compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated three times with independent cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each biological replicate was tested in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA plasmid was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test was used for comparison between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability greater than 85% compared to control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability less than 60% compared to control.
